comment.author: 46771658@N02
comment._content: This looks exactly like the Steel Bridge Downtown Portland!

comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content: You are quite right -- but I think it is actually the Union Street Bridge in Salem. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/travelsalem/4037827281/] Want to see more? Flickr user "Travel Salem" has a great set called Union Street Railroad Pedestrian & Bicycle Bridge. Here's what I learned from them: "In April 2009, Salem opened the transformed Union Street Railroad steel bridge and timber trestle into a new passage for bicyclists and pedestrians. Two large parks – Wallace Marine Park and Riverfront Park - bookend this historic Willamette River crossing. The converted bridge connects Salem’s bicycle and pedestrian systems into a single, safe, and enjoyable network." [http://www.flickr.com/photos/travelsalem/4038575506/] Want to know more? The Wikipedia article is quite good. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/travelsalem/4037826987]

comment.author: 29783535@N07
comment._content:
Hey thanks for the props :)

The bridge is temporarily closed to finished repairs. It will reopen in May 2010.
